paper.title: Automata and Rational Expressions on Planar Graphs

author.org: Université de Lille I, UFR d'IEEA
Université de Lille I, UFR d'IEEA
Université de Lille I, UFR d'IEEA

paper.abstract: We study languages (i.e. sets) of planar directed acyclic graphs (pdags). These pdags are constructed by parallel composition and serial composition of letters and pdags on a doubly ranked alphabet. Our purpose is to introduce an algorithmic process (generalization of Kamimura and Slutzkiu0027s parallel automata) for accepting pdag languages and a specification of these languages by means of well-suited rational expressions. So our main result is a Kleene-like theorem proving the equivalence between rationality and automaton-definability.
